Package com.example.inventorymanager

Class ScanningTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.inventorymanager.ScanningTest
public class ScanningTest extends Object
Conducts comprehensive UI testing on the item scanning functionalities. Verifies that the description and serial number fields can be filled out properly. Tests US 5.1 and 5.2. All tests should be run on Pixel 6 API 34.
Author:
Isaac Joffe

  • Method Details

    • stubCameraIntent

      public void stubCameraIntent()
      Sets the Camera Intent() called within the application to be mocked. Returns the sample data image in all cases when the Camera Intent() is called. We know, Android's Camera Intent() is well-tested and works, so we only test the new functionality.

    • tearDown

      public void tearDown()
      Destroy this Camera Intent() mock after the tests have finished.

    • login

      private void login()
      Logs in the default user, JohnDoe.

      Create an Item() using an auto-generated description.

      Create an Item() using an auto-generated serial number.

    • deleteItem

      private void deleteItem()
      Delete the Item() created so the tests can be later re-ran without error.

      private void scrollToBottom()
      Allows to scroll down to the bottom of the fragment

    • testScanDescription

      public void testScanDescription()
      Test that the description can be correctly auto-generated. Tests US 5.2.

    • testScanSerialNumber

      public void testScanSerialNumber()
      Test that the serial number can be correctly detected. Tests US 5.1.
